conclusion: The two rods and the rails form one closed circuit with total resistance of 0.2 Ω.
The motional emfs for rods a and b are Ea = B L va and Eb = B L vb, respectively.
The instantaneous current is I = (Ea - Eb) / Rtot = B L (va - vb) / 0.2.
Each rod experiences a magnetic force due to the current and magnetic field.
The magnetic force on rod a is FBa = -k' (va - vb) and on rod b is FBb = +k' (va - vb), where k' = B²L²/0.2 = 0.05 N·s m⁻¹.
The pulling force on rod a is +F = +2 N, and the gravity components on rods a and b are -(ma + mb)g sin θ = -2 N.
The net external force on the system is zero at every instant: F - (ma + mb)g sin θ = 0.
The total external impulse is zero, so the momentum along the rail is conserved.
Using momentum conservation, vb = -ma/mb va = -3.0 m s⁻¹.
The speed magnitude of rod b is |vb| = 3.0 m s⁻¹.
